key_risks: Supply chain disruptions including raw material shortages, logistics delays, and rising costs
Environmental impact due to reliance on plastics and adhesives
Competition from major players like 3M, CCL Industries, and UPM-Kymmene
Regulatory compliance challenges related to materials, chemicals, and labeling standards
controversies: Significant waste from overproduction and improper forecasting, with 8% of stock perishing or being discarded annually
Potential disruptions from the Red Sea affecting supply chain resilience
environmental_issues: Reliance on plastics and adhesives raising concerns about waste and recyclability
Commitment to achieving 100% recyclable or reusable packaging by 2030 and reducing greenhouse gas emissions
social_issues: Strong commitment to human rights, health, and safety across operations and supply chain
governance_issues: Complex regulations related to materials, chemicals, and labeling standards across different regions

sources.title: Over-production hurting supply chains - Avery Dennison
sources.snippet: Avery Dennison says up to 3.6% of annual profits are being lost as nearly 8% of stock perishes or is discarded. It says the loss includes 4.3% of stock that spoils in the supply chain before it even reaches the shelf, with a further 3.4% discarded due to over-production. In total, the loss amounts to an estimate US$163.1bn of inventory.
